intro: Ampelodesmos mauritanicus var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored climbing vine, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive bi-colored leaves, which typically display a mix of green and white or yellow tones. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually pale yellow or white, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. This species is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and resilience.
